author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name is not at least five characters long

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->

I think the name Tar.jl is just fine, but given the scope of the package you could potentially use Targit.jl or Gittar.jl.  Both lend themselves to some great logos ðŸŽ¯ ðŸŽ¸ and make it clear that it's not (and will never be) a full implementation.
Hold off on merging this, please. I'm going to think a bit about the scope and defaults for this packageâ€”whether it will be limited to what it does now or support more in the future.

FWIW I think Tar.jl is fine.

You could also do PosixTar.jl to emphasize the specification that you implement.

[noblock]
I think I'm going to go with Tar but I want to clarify the scope in the README first and think a bit about defaults in consideration of future features which broaden the scope beyond git.

> I think I'm going to go with Tar but I want to clarify the scope in the README first and think a bit about default in consideration of future features which broaden the scope beyond git.

Sounds good. I can merge this whenever you are ready, just let me know.
